edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.connectfour.Logic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.connectfour.Logic.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board object that handles the logic of the game board HAS-A reference to the Game object, and BoardDisplay
    Version:
    CS56 F16 UCSB
    Author:
    Vincent Tan, Girish Kowligi, Joel Bagan, Bryanna Phan, Brian Lee

      Constructor that creates white circles and puts one in every spot in gameGrid

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkAntiDiagonal()
      Checks for a winning string of 4 circles in South-West (Anti-diagonal) direction Sets winX and winY to the spot at which the string of circles starts for the draw function to have somewhere to start

      Determines if a draw has occurred and sets gameIsOver to true if there is a draw\

      void restart()
      Method called when restarting the game, exactly the same as constructor but also sets drawCounter to 0 We just thought calling the constructor again may mess up the mouseListenter or display, so we just made this which makes all circles white again.

        public Board()
        Constructor that creates white circles and puts one in every spot in gameGrid

    • Method Detail

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Method called when restarting the game, exactly the same as constructor but also sets drawCounter to 0 We just thought calling the constructor again may mess up the mouseListenter or display, so we just made this which makes all circles white again.

      • checkDraw

        public boolean checkDraw()
        Determines if a draw has occurred and sets gameIsOver to true if there is a draw\
        Returns:
        true if 42 circles drawn and no win detected, else false

      • checkVertical

        public boolean checkVertical()
        Checks for a winning string of 4 circles in vertical direction Sets winX and winY to the spot at which the string of circles starts for the draw function to have somewhere to start
        Returns:
        true if winning string found, else false

      • checkMainDiagonal

        public boolean checkMainDiagonal()
        Checks for a winning string of 4 circles in South-East (Main-diagonal) direction Sets winX and winY to the spot at which the string of circles starts for the draw function to have somewhere to start
        Returns:
        true if winning string found, else false

      • checkAntiDiagonal

        public boolean checkAntiDiagonal()
        Checks for a winning string of 4 circles in South-West (Anti-diagonal) direction Sets winX and winY to the spot at which the string of circles starts for the draw function to have somewhere to start
        Returns:
        true if winning string found, else false

      • checkHorizontal

        public boolean checkHorizontal()
        Checks for a winning string of 4 circles in horizontal direction Sets winX and winY to the spot at which the string of circles starts for the draw function to have somewhere to start
        Returns:
        true if winning string found, else false
